task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 331°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full building (base and roofline) to estimate height, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The heading has shifted to due North, so I should rotate back to the target building’s NW direction (~332°) while keeping the upward tilt to capture the roofline for height estimation.
I need a clearer view of the building’s top to judge total height, so I should tilt up while staying on the correct NW heading.
Again the view snapped to 0°N; I must rotate back left to ~332° while keeping the upward pitch to keep the building in frame.
Since pitching up keeps resetting the heading view afterward, I should instead move closer to improve scale and see more of the facade for a height estimate.
I’m now facing NE, so I should rotate left to the provided ~329° heading to align with the target NW-facing building.
I overshot to 270°W and need to turn right toward ~331°NW to face the target building.
The interface offers a direct left rotation to heading 331°, which matches the target NW direction, so I should take it to face the building.
To reach ~331° from 270° I should rotate right by about 61° to face the target building.
Instead of rotating a fixed -90° again, I should rotate left by 90° then further adjust if needed; first take the left turn toward 331°.
I’m stuck oscillating; I should directly set a custom rotation from 270° to 331° by yaw +61° to face the building.
The view keeps snapping between 270° and 61°, so I should stop rotating and provide an estimate based on the apparent multi-story building height (about 3 floors at ~3.5 m each plus roof).
